name: Confederation of the European Bicycle Industry ASBL
membership: CONEBI is a founding member of the World Bicycle Industry Association (WBIA). www.wbia.ch
goal:
The Confederation of the European Bicycle Industry - CONEBI - is the result of the merger between COLIPED the Association of the European Two-Wheeler Parts’ and Accessories’ Industry and COLIBI the Association of the European Bicycle and EPAC Industry. Thus CONEBI represents the interests of the European Bicycle, Electric Power-Assisted Cycles and Parts & Accessories Industries.
CONEBI groups the EU National Bicycle Industry Associations.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, Research and innovation, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
The European Bicycle Industry has the priority of putting high-quality and safe products on the market and for this reason CONEBI is currently participating in the discussions

- with DG Industry of the European Commission on the testing methods for the integrity of Speed-EPACs

- within the European Committee for Normalisation on the latest developments of EN and ISO standards

- with the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) about testing procedures for Speed-Epacs helmets

CONEBI does not only focus on the quality and safety of the Bicycle Industry products: CONEBI is actively working for the proper application of the European Union Directive on Waste Electric & Electronic Equipment and the European Union Regulation REACH to face the risks that can be posed by chemicals.

Thanks to the strong Corporate Social Responsibility that characterizes the European Bicycle Industry, CONEBI is working with EUCOBAT, the European Association of national collection schemes for batteries, on a joint position to be presented to the European Institutions for battery recycling of Epacs, Speed-Epacs and e-bikes in Europe.

CONEBI is also working on
- the issue of counterfeits,
- a re-industrialization project
- promoting cycling infrastructures
